trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Panorama9 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Panorama9 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Panorama9 with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Panorama9 with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Panorama9.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Panorama9.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Panorama9 single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Panorama9 single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Panorama9 will be able to single sign into the application at your Panorama9 company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Panorama9 will be able to single sign into the application at your Panorama9 company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Panorama9
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Panorama9

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Panorama9.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Panorama9.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Panorama9.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Panorama9.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Panorama9, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Panorama9, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Panorama9</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Panorama9</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Panorama9 with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Panorama9 with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Panorama9 requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Panorama9 requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Panorama9 application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Panorama9 application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Panorama9 page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Panorama9 page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Panorama9 Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign in to Panorama9 (e.g.: “https://dashboard.panorama9.com/saml/access/3262"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Panorama9 Sign On URL textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign in to Panorama9 (e.g.: “https://dashboard.panorama9.com/saml/access/3262"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Panorama9 page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save it locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Panorama9 page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save it locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Panorama9 company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Panorama9 company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click Manage, and then click Extensions.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click Manage, and then click Extensions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Extensions</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Extensions</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Extensions dialog, click Single Sign-On.
trans-unit.target: On the Extensions dialog, click Single Sign-On.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Panorama9 dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Identity provider URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Panorama9 dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Identity provider URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Certificate fingerprint textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Certificate fingerprint textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Panorama9, they must be provisioned into Panorama9.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Panorama9, they must be provisioned into Panorama9.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Panorama9, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Panorama9, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Panorama9 company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Panorama9 company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Manage, and then click Users.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Manage, and then click Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click +.
trans-unit.target: Click +.

trans-unit.source: In the User data section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the User data section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email textbox, type the email address of a valid Azure Active Directory user you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Panorama9 user account creation tools or APIs provided by Panorama9 to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Panorama9 user account creation tools or APIs provided by Panorama9 to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Panorama9 application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Panorama9 application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
